pytket.backendsÂ¶

class pytket.backends.BackendÂ¶

This abstract class defines the structure of a backend as something that can run quantum circuits and produce output as at least one of shots, counts, state, or unitary

__init__() → NoneÂ¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

abstract circuit_status(handle: pytket.backends.resulthandle.ResultHandle) → pytket.backends.status.CircuitStatusÂ¶

Return a CircuitStatus reporting the status of the circuit execution corresponding to the ResultHandle

compile_circuit(circuit: pytket.circuit.Circuit) → NoneÂ¶

Apply the default_compilation_pass to a circuit in place.

Parameters

circuit (Circuit) â The circuit to compile.

empty_cache() → NoneÂ¶

Manually empty the result cache on the backend.

get_counts(circuit: Union[pytket.circuit.Circuit, pytket.backends.resulthandle.ResultHandle], n_shots: Optional[int] = None, basis: pytket.circuit.BasisOrder = BasisOrder.ilo, valid_check: bool = True, **kwargs: Union[int, float, None]) → Dict[Tuple[int, â¦], int]Â¶

Obtain a summary of results, accumulating the shots for each result from an experiment. Can either accept a ResultHandle for a processed circuit to retrieve the data from the backendâs cache, or a Circuit to be run and immediately returned. This will fail if the circuit does not match the deviceâs requirements.

Parameters

  • circuit (Union[Circuit, ResultHandle]) â The circuit to run, or results to retrieve

  • n_shots (Optional[int], optional) â Number of shots to generate from the circuit. Defaults to None

  • basis (BasisOrder, optional) â Toggle between ILO (increasing lexicographic order of bit ids) and DLO (decreasing lexicographic order) for column ordering. Defaults to BasisOrder.ilo.

  • valid_check (bool, optional) â Explicitly check that the circuit satisfies all of the required predicates before running. Defaults to True

Raises

NotImplementedError â If backend implementation does not support counts retrieval

Returns

Dictionary mapping observed readouts to the number of times observed.

Return type

Dict[Tuple[int, ..], int]

get_result(handle: pytket.backends.resulthandle.ResultHandle, **kwargs: Union[int, float, None]) → pytket.backends.backendresult.BackendResultÂ¶

Return a BackendResult corresponding to the handle.

Use keyword arguments to specify parameters to be used in retrieving results. See specific Backend derived class for available parameters, from the following list:

  • timeout: maximum time to wait for remote job to finish

  • wait: polling interval between remote calls to check job status

Parameters

handle (ResultHandle) â handle to results

Returns

Results corresponding to handle.

Return type

BackendResult

get_shots(circuit: Union[pytket.circuit.Circuit, pytket.backends.resulthandle.ResultHandle], n_shots: Optional[int] = None, basis: pytket.circuit.BasisOrder = BasisOrder.ilo, valid_check: bool = True, **kwargs: Union[int, float, None]) → numpy.ndarrayÂ¶

Obtain the table of shots from an experiment. Can either accept a ResultHandle for a processed circuit to retrieve the data from the backendâs cache, or a Circuit to be run and immediately returned. This will fail if the circuit does not match the deviceâs requirements.

Parameters

  • circuit (Union[Circuit, ResultHandle]) â The circuit to run, or results to retrieve

  • n_shots (Optional[int], optional) â Number of shots to generate from the circuit. Defaults to None

  • basis (BasisOrder, optional) â Toggle between ILO (increasing lexicographic order of bit ids) and DLO (decreasing lexicographic order) for column ordering. Defaults to BasisOrder.ilo.

  • valid_check (bool, optional) â Explicitly check that the circuit satisfies all of the required predicates before running. Defaults to True

Raises

NotImplementedError â If backend implementation does not support shot table retrieval

Returns

Table of shot results. Each row is a single shot, with columns ordered by classical bit order (according to basis). Entries are 0 or 1 corresponding to qubit basis states.

Return type

np.ndarray

get_state(circuit: Union[pytket.circuit.Circuit, pytket.backends.resulthandle.ResultHandle], basis: pytket.circuit.BasisOrder = BasisOrder.ilo, valid_check: bool = True) → numpy.ndarrayÂ¶

Obtain a statevector from a simulation. Can either accept a ResultHandle for a processed circuit to retrieve data from the backendâs cache, or a Circuit to be run and immediately returned. This will fail if the circuit does not match the simulatorâs requirements.

Parameters

  • circuit (Union[Circuit, ResultHandle]) â The circuit to run, or results to retrieve

  • basis (BasisOrder, optional) â Toggle between ILO-BE (increasing lexicographic order of bit ids, big-endian) and DLO-BE (decreasing lexicographic order, big-endian) for ordering the coefficients. Defaults to BasisOrder.ilo.

  • valid_check (bool, optional) â Explicitly check that the circuit satisfies all of the required predicates before running. Defaults to True

Raises

NotImplementedError â If backend implementation does not support statevector retrieval

Returns

A big-endian statevector for the circuit in the encoding given by basis; e.g. \([a_{00}, a_{01}, a_{10}, a_{11}]\) where \(a_{01}\) is the amplitude of the \(\left|01\right>\) state (in ILO, this means qubit q[0] is in state \(\left|0\right>\) and q[1] is in state \(\left|1\right>\), and the reverse in DLO)

Return type

np.ndarray

pop_result(handle: pytket.backends.resulthandle.ResultHandle) → Dict[str, Any]Â¶

Remove cache entry corresponding to handle from the cache and return.

Parameters

handle (ResultHandle) â ResultHandle object

Returns

Cache entry corresponding to handle

Return type

Any

abstract process_circuits(circuits: Iterable[pytket.circuit.Circuit], n_shots: Optional[int] = None, valid_check: bool = True, **kwargs: Union[int, float, None]) → List[pytket.backends.resulthandle.ResultHandle]Â¶

Submit circuits to the backend for running. The results will be stored in the backendâs result cache to be retrieved by the corresponding get_<data> method.

Use keyword arguments to specify parameters to be used in submitting circuits See specific Backend derived class for available parameters, from the following list:

  • seed: RNG seed for simulators

Parameters

  • circuits (Iterable[Circuit]) â Circuits to process on the backend.

  • n_shots (Optional[int], optional) â Number of shots to run per circuit. None is to be used for state/unitary simulators. Defaults to None.

  • valid_check (bool, optional) â Explicitly check that all circuits satisfy all required predicates to run on the backend. Defaults to True

Returns

Handles to results for each input circuit, as an interable in the same order as the circuits.

Return type

List[ResultHandle]

valid_circuit(circuit: pytket.circuit.Circuit) → boolÂ¶

Checks that the circuit satisfies all of required_predicates.

Parameters

circuit (Circuit) â The circuit to check.

Returns

Whether or not all of required_predicates are satisfied.

Return type

bool

abstract property default_compilation_passÂ¶

A suggested compilation pass that will guarantee the resulting circuit will be suitable to run on this backend with as few preconditions as possible.

Returns

Compilation pass guaranteeing required predicates.

Return type

BasePass

property deviceÂ¶

Retrieve the Device targeted by the backend if it exists.

Returns

The Device that this backend targets if it exists. The Device object contains information about gate errors and device architecture.

Return type

Optional[Device]

property persistent_handlesÂ¶

Whether the backend produces ResultHandle objects that can be reused with other instances of the backend class.

abstract property required_predicatesÂ¶

The minimum set of predicates that a circuit must satisfy before it can be successfully run on this backend.

Returns

Required predicates.

Return type

List[Predicate]

property supports_countsÂ¶

Does this backend support counts result retrieval via get_counts.

property supports_expectationÂ¶

Does this backend support expectation value calculation for operators.

property supports_shotsÂ¶

Does this backend support shot result retrieval via get_shots.

property supports_stateÂ¶

Does this backend support statevector retrieval via get_state.

property supports_unitaryÂ¶

Does this backend support unitary retrieval via get_unitary.
